TopicTitle: Tutorial for building/transporting a KAS ground construction vehicle?

Articles.Content: I have plans to build a ground station, and I need a ground construction vehicle to tow and move air dropped components around and attach them. The problem is, I had no idea how to build one in-situ or how to transport a fully built one from KSC to landing site due to the size involved. And I have seen people with such vehicles in other planets! Is it possible, or did those people just use extraplanetary launch pad?

For example, have you ssen this guy's channel?

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGrBYmOsaW5lDVGUVPjN6qA/videos

Nope. Funny that I didn't search for "crane design" but I searched for "ground construction vehicle", which didn't give me the guy's crane design video. That is useful. Though I can't fly something like that with NEAR. Will try to figure a way.

on what planet/moon would you like to build? in low gravity i usually use a skycrane to deorbit and dock modules vertically. a bit tricky but it works. on minmus i just dropped the entire 108 ton supply base in one piece because the gravity is so low anyways.

in the pic you can see a skycrane design. just make sure it's wide enough so it doesn't thrust into the load (like the one refueling, that's why there is a bigger one parked behind it) you might want to strut the heavier loads to the crane with KAS

Build a crane with IR

Getting it to location can be abit tricky with balancing and as frustrating as it some times gets, it quite abit of fun

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Lol, I wonder how I am going to fly those beasts into orbit with NEAR. But I have been attempting to build my own tiny crane too. The result wasn't that good, but it serves the purpose when nothing else is available:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Here is my second attempt at building a more stable crane/space plane hybrid, but I gave up on it at the moment, since the thing can't take off in anyway.

Gotta think of a new design. Not many can fit a cargo bay, and not many can be flown with NEAR.

Lol, I wonder how I am going to fly those beasts into orbit with NEAR

As I can understand, NEAR is a lite version of FAR. Do you use Procedural Fairings or KW Rocketry to protect you cargo?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/39512-0-25-Procedural-Fairings-3-10-payload-auto-struts-%28October-11%29

As I can understand, NEAR is a lite version of FAR. Do you use Procedural Fairings or KW Rocketry to protect you cargo?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/39512-0-25-Procedural-Fairings-3-10-payload-auto-struts-%28October-11%29

Yeah, I have Procedural Fairings. I imagine a near-dish-like top with vehicles that are very wide would still diminish the effect of the fairing though. That is why I try to design my vehicles long and thin.

Sorry for only partially related reply, but forums won't let me post a new thread from my phone.

With KAS, I can't seem to use the Strut End Point on my space station orbiting Kerbin. I EVA and right click on it but I don't get any options; no response at all. Anyone know why that might be?

I've tried the construction vehicle approach to assembling bases - and found it very tedious, difficult and finicky to get right. A much better approach is to have wheels on your base modules and then just park them into place. Now, these wheels need not be permanent. Attach wheels to a girder that itself is attached to the module via a radial decoupler, like so for instance:

In the end, I didn't even bother with a lander, as it got tedious with all the docking, refueling and so on just to land down one module at a time. So added some simple rocket parts to the modules to get them to Mun orbit and land them. Again - detachable when done with:

Worked really well

The wheels on base modules are good for horizontal expansion, but when you need to stack things on top of each others, like what I would do with a radio tower for my RT2 control center base, I need something that can lift it up and put it on top of one of the modules, or when the modules flipped over and need to be righted up - especially important when I might be air dropping those things with chutes over uneven terrain, for example.
use ground construction a good mod
